intro: Huntleya candida, commonly known as the white-flowered rock heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, white, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Huntleya candida has narrow, evergreen leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
